CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 2, 1946, pg. 1 reads: "Taxi Hearing - A portion of the witnesses at the hearing on the petitions for Negro taxicab companies, which would operate to and from the Hill District, is shown in Public Utilities Hearing Rooms in Common Pleas court here Monday and Wednesday, in bottom [top] picture. In the group are Atty. Jerome Solomon, who represented the Birtha & Son Cab Co., and the Owl Taxicab Co., in their petition; Atty. Paul F. Jones, assistant counsel, who entered the case as chairman of the local NAACP Redress Committee and on behalf of Crispus Attucks Post, American Legion; the Rev. T.J. King, Frank Clark and Mrs. Alma Illery.  Raymond Birtha, who would operate the Birtha & Son Cab Co., is shown testifying as Examiner Maurice Claster, on bench at far right, hears testimony.  Silas Knox, one of the partners of the proposed Owl Taxicab Co., testified also on Wednesday. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Raymond Birtha seated on witness stand testifying during taxicab petition hearings with Examiner Maurice Claster seated on right, in Public Utilities Hearing Rooms in Common Pleas Court
